name: A. Romaji
statement:
Vitya has just started learning Berlanese language. It is known that
Berlanese uses the Latin alphabet. Vowel letters are "", "", "", "", and
"". Other letters are consonant.In Berlanese, there has to be a vowel
after every consonant, but there can be any letter after any vowel. The
only exception is a consonant ""; after this letter, there can be any
letter (not only a vowel) or there can be no letter at all. For example,
the words "", "", "", and "" are Berlanese while the words "", "", "",
and "" are not.Help Vitya find out if a word s is Berlanese.
editorial:
You need to check if after every letter except one of for these "",
there goes one of these "". Do not forget to check the last letter.
